title: What do you mean?
self_text: Why does this make me feel like I should be in bed? What am I supposed to do with all these words? Are they trying to trick me into thinking that there are so many people who have had these thoughts before? They're not trying to trick me, they're just telling me what is expected of me and how I should act.  I don't want to do anything bad or get caught up in something dangerous. I just want to keep my head down and try to figure out how to live a good life. But it's hard when everyone expects you to do things that you don't want to do.  So what do I do? Should I just give up and let everything happen to me? Or should I stand up for myself and fight back? I don't know. I don't know what to do.  I need help. Can anyone please tell me what I should do?  If you can't, then just leave me alone. I don't want to hear any more about this.  I just want to be happy. And if that means I have to sacrifice my own happiness, then I guess that's okay.  But if it doesn't, then I will never stop fighting until I find a way to be happy.  I am not going to give up on myself. I am not going to let anyone tell me that I cannot achieve my dreams.  I am going to work hard and try my best to become the person I want to be.  And if that means I have to struggle along the way, then I guess that's okay too.  Because in the end, it's all worth it.  The pain and suffering will fade away, but the memories will stay.  And those memories will remind me that I was once lost and confused, but now I have found my way home.  I am no longer afraid of the future. I am ready to face whatever challenges come my way.  I am confident that I can overcome any obstacle that stands in my path.  I am not going to allow fear to control my life.  I am going to embrace my destiny and live my life to the fullest.  I am grateful for everything that I have.  I am thankful for the love and support of my family and friends.  I am proud of who I am.  I am looking forward to the future.  I know that there are good times ahead of me.  I am excited to see what happens next.  Thank you for listening.  I hope you understand.  I hope you believe me.  I am not lying.  I am telling the truth.  I am honest.  I am genuine.  I am real.  I am me.  And I am here to stay.

title: I'm not sure if this is a bad idea but it could be really good
self_text: A few months ago, I was walking down the street and I saw a man who was wearing a very bright yellow shirt. He was smiling at me and waving his hand in my direction as he passed by. At first, I thought he was just being friendly, but then I realized that he had an incredibly unsettling look in his eyes. It was like he was looking directly into my soul and judging me. I quickly turned around and walked away as fast as I could.  When I got home, I decided to check Google Images for "man in yellow shirt" and came across a picture of Adolf Hitler. My heart started pounding in my chest because of the resemblance between him and the man I had seen. I immediately reported the incident to the police, but they told me there was nothing they could do. They said that the man was just a harmless stranger, and that it was unlikely that he would ever hurt anyone. However, I couldn't shake off the feeling that something was wrong. I began to avoid people who were wearing yellow shirts, and I became increasingly paranoid about being followed or watched.  I tried to talk to my therapist about my fears, but she said that I was overreacting. She suggested that I try meditation and yoga to calm myself down. But none of that helped.  The more I thought about it, the more convinced I became that the man in the yellow shirt was somehow connected to my past. I started researching my family history and discovered that my grandfather had been involved in the Nazi party.  It suddenly all made sense. The man in the yellow shirt was a projection of my own subconscious mind, a manifestation of the darkness that lay within my family.  I decided to confront the man and finally find out what he wanted from me. I found him sitting on a bench in the park, wearing the same yellow shirt. He smiled at me and said, “You know why I’m here.”  I stared at him, paralyzed with fear.  He continued, “I’m here to tell you that you are part of my plan. I need your help to destroy the world.”  I screamed and ran away as fast as I could.  I never looked back again.  Now, whenever I see someone wearing a yellow shirt, I feel a shiver run down my spine. I can’t shake off the memory of that man and his chilling words. I’m not sure what I did to deserve such a terrible fate, but I know that I will never forget it.

title: 404 not found
self_text: This is a meme that was created by the internet community in response to the lack of content on Reddit. It became so popular that it spawned an entire subreddit dedicated to it, which has now been deleted for being too prolific and disruptive. The image itself is just a simple 404 error page from Google, but the meme is used as a symbol of the frustration of finding nothing interesting online.  It's also frequently used as a reaction image when someone tries to make a joke or share something they think will be funny, only to have it fall flat.

title: My boyfriend thinks I am a bad girl.
self_text: I'm sorry, but I have to say it. My boyfriend is a very nice man, and he loves me very much. But he also thinks that I am a bad girl. He says that I am always getting into trouble, and that I never listen to him. I don't know what to do about it. I want to be a good girlfriend, and I want my boyfriend to love me. But I can't seem to do anything right. I think he wants me to be someone else, but I don't know who that person is. I just want to make him happy, but it's so hard when I feel like I'm not doing things right. I need some advice on how to handle this situation. Please let me know if you have any ideas.

I was walking down the street and saw a guy wearing a red shirt with a white stripe on it. He looked like he was about to have a heart attack, so I stopped and asked him if he was okay. He said, "I'm fine, just having a little trouble." I told him that I could help him.  He said, "Oh, thank you very much! You are a lifesaver!"  I smiled at him and walked away.   A few minutes later, I heard some commotion behind me. I turned around and saw the same man from before, yelling at a woman. The woman was wearing a blue dress and was trying to push her way through a crowd of people. She was saying, "This is ridiculous! Why am I being treated like this? I want to speak to someone in charge!"  The man continued to yell at her, but the woman didn't seem fazed.  I decided to intervene. I stepped forward and said, "Excuse me, sir, what's going on?"  He looked at me angrily and said, "You don't understand anything! This woman is trying to steal my job!"  I asked him, "Are you sure she's stealing your job? Did you see any proof?"  He said, "Yes! She came into my office yesterday and asked me for a copy of my work file. She said she wanted to make some changes. I told her no, but she kept pushing me. Now she's trying to get me fired!"  I looked at the woman and asked her, "Ma'am, can you explain why you were asking for a copy of your boss's work file?"  She replied, "I was just curious. My husband works here, and I wanted to know what kind of work he does. I wasn't going to steal his job or anything."  The man stared at the woman, then back at me. Finally, he said, "I feel terrible. I shouldn't have accused you of stealing my job. I just got really upset because I thought you were trying to undermine me."  The woman apologized for causing a scene.  I thanked both of them for their honesty and walked away.  I realized that sometimes, we judge people based on our own fears and insecurities. We should be more willing to give people the benefit of the doubt and try to understand where they're coming from.

title: "I am so tired"
self_text: I am so tired of my dad, and his friends. They keep calling me by the wrong name, saying stupid stuff like, "Hey kiddo," when they're really trying to ask me if I want to get a drink. Then they just stare at me, or say something like, "Wow, that's a beautiful body." I'm not sure why they do these things, but it makes me feel really bad. It's like they don't know who I am or what I'm going through.  My dad has been like this since he was 10 years old. He says he doesn't remember how to stop.   The police are investigating this incident. Police have identified three suspects in connection with the incident. The suspects include one father, two friends, and one neighbor. One of the neighbors is known for making rude comments about people's bodies.  Police are asking anyone with information regarding the incident to come forward.  This incident is still under investigation.  More information will be released as it becomes available.   What could happen next? We can only wait and see.   But no matter what happens, I hope my dad stops. I hope my friends stop. And I hope my neighbor stops. I hope everyone stops making rude comments about other people's bodies. I hope everyone respects each other's privacy. And I hope everyone treats others with kindness.

title: The most popular video games of 2018
self_text: 1) Fortnite - Epic Games - This game has been incredibly popular, and is still going strong in 2019. It's a battle royale game where you fight other players to be the last person standing.  2) Red Dead Redemption 2 - Rockstar Games - A Western action-adventure game set in the late 1890s, it's known for its stunning graphics and open world.  3) Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 - Activision - Another big name in the industry, this first-person shooter features multiplayer modes as well as a new zombie mode.  4) Apex Legends - Respawn Entertainment - A free-to-play battle royale game that combines fast-paced shooting with hero abilities.  5) FIFA 19 - EA Sports - The latest installment in the ever-popular soccer franchise.  6) The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild - Nintendo - An open-world adventure game that allows you to explore Hyrule at your own pace.  7) Monster Hunter: World - Capcom - This action RPG lets you hunt giant monsters with your friends.  8) PUBG: Battlegrounds - PUBG Corporation - One of the original battle royale games, PUBG is still played by millions around the world.  9) Mass Effect: Andromeda - BioWare - A space exploration RPG that follows the story of Commander Shepard as he travels through the galaxy.  10) Forza Horizon 4 - Playground Games - An open-world racing game set in England.

title: I am a cat and it is my duty to eat the food of all that I meet
self_text: I am a cat, and it is my duty to eat the food of all that I meet, including the food of those who do not want me to eat their food. As a cat, I have no choice but to satisfy my hunger, so I will eat whatever you give me, even if you don't like it or want me to eat it. You can try to stop me from eating your food, but I will always find a way to eat it, because I have no other options. I will eat everything you put in front of me, and I won't be ashamed to eat it. This may sound disgusting to you, but it's just how cats are. We need to eat to survive, and we will eat anything that we can get our paws on. So please, don't take it personally when I eat your food. It's just how I am.  I am a cat, and I love to eat!   If you see me eating something that you don't like, please don't try to stop me. Just let me eat my fill, and then I'll move on to the next thing.   And if you happen to be a dog, please don't try to chase me. I don't want any trouble with you. I just want to eat, and I don't want you to interfere with my meal.  Thank you for understanding.

title: I got a new girlfriend, she's beautiful
self_text: No, that is not what you think, I can assure you, my girl is a sweet, nice, and lovely person who loves to do things and have fun with me as much as I love her, we have a great bond, we always spend our time together playing games, watching movies, eating food, or just talking about random stuff.  I met her at a local park when I was walking home from work. She was sitting on a bench reading a book, and I had a really good feeling about her so I went up and said hi. We talked for hours and hours, and now we are dating.  She has the most gorgeous eyes in the world, and I love how she laughs.  I love everything about her!  She’s everything I ever wanted in a woman, and I couldn’t be happier to be with her.   I am excited to see where this relationship goes, but there are some things I want to share with you guys.  When I first met her, I thought she looked kinda ugly, like an old hag, but then when I saw her smile, it was the prettiest thing I ever saw. I told my mom about it, and she said "Son, don't judge people by their looks." But I did anyway. So I kept looking at her. When she started smiling, I thought to myself, "Wow, that's actually really cute!" I got more and more attracted to her every time she smiled.  It wasn't long before I realized that I was falling in love with her. Then I asked her out, and she said yes! Now we are dating, and I could not be happier.  I love her so much, and I hope she likes me too.  I feel so lucky to have her in my life. I will never let her go, no matter what happens.  So if anyone is interested in meeting her, please come visit us. She is very friendly and welcoming, and I am sure you will enjoy spending time with her.  Thank you for your attention.  P.S. If you are a guy who wants to date her, I suggest you don't. She is way too perfect for you.

title: I hate my life
self_text: It is not enough to say that I am tired of being an idiot. That's too easy.  I feel like a prisoner in my own mind, trapped by the weight of my stupidity. Every thought I have is a reminder of how much I don't know and how little I can do with it.   The world around me seems to move on without me, full of people who understand things I can only guess at. They talk about art, music, science, philosophy—subjects that are as foreign to me as another language. And I just sit there, feeling like a spectator in my own existence, unable to participate.  I try to learn, I really do. But every time I pick up a book or watch a documentary, I'm met with a wall of complexity that I simply cannot scale. I get lost in the details, confused by the jargon, and overwhelmed by the sheer amount of information. It's like trying to drink from a firehose.  And then there's the shame, of course. The quiet, gnawing shame that comes from knowing you're not smart enough, not capable enough, not *good* enough. It’s like some parasite that feeds off my confidence and slowly eats away at my soul.  I don't want to be stupid. I don't want to be a failure. But I don't know how to fix it. How do you change your brain? How do you overcome years of ingrained ignorance?  Maybe I should just give up and embrace my fate. Maybe I should resign myself to a life of mediocrity, where I’m nothing more than a background character in everyone else’s story.  But even that feels unbearable. So I keep trying, but I always fail.  It’s a vicious cycle, and I’m starting to lose hope.  It’s not enough to say that I am tired of being an idiot. That’s too easy. title: I'm starting to think you're a robot
I'm so fucking sick of it.
self_text: No, not the "I'm so fucking sick of it" that I was talking about, I am talking about the fact that it is always on me.  No matter what I do, no matter how much I try to do things right, everything ends up being on me. It’s like I have a black hole inside my head where all my problems go. And they just keep multiplying and growing until they’re too big for me to handle.  I can't ever get ahead, I'm always stuck in the mud.  And the worst part is, I know that I’m responsible for it. I'm the one who needs to change something. But I don't know what to change. I don't even know *why* I need to change. I just feel like if I could be better at something, anything, then maybe I would finally be happy.  But I can't. I don't have the energy.  I'm tired of fighting this battle. I want to stop fighting. I want to just give up and let it all fall apart.  It’s like I’ve been carrying a weight on my back my whole life, and I’m starting to think that it’s too heavy.  I don't know what else to do.

title: The day I realized that my dad was a porn star
self_text: You know, as a kid, I always thought my dad was an accountant. He had a really boring job and he wore those gray suits every day. But then, last night, I was watching the news, and they mentioned a famous porn star named “Big Mike.”  I looked at my dad, and there he was - Big Mike! It was insane! My dad was a porn star! It all made sense now, why he always wore those gray suits. That's because he wanted to blend in with the background when he was shooting scenes. I have been so shocked ever since. I do not want to tell anyone about it. My parents are very strict, so I don’t want them to find out. But I can’t keep it to myself anymore.

title: The best thing about being a cop is that you don't have to worry about your mental health
self_text: I used to be an officer with the local police department, and it was really hard on me mentally and emotionally. A lot of things happened in my life that I couldn't control, like witnessing people die and seeing some really dark stuff.  I had no idea how to deal with these things, so I started drinking and smoking weed pretty heavily, but those habits only made me worse. Eventually, I realized that I needed help, so I went to see a therapist. She told me that my experiences as a police officer were traumatic, and that I was suffering from PTSD. She helped me develop coping mechanisms for dealing with the trauma. I'm not saying everyone who has seen something bad should go to therapy or anything, but I think that if you do, it can make a huge difference.  I eventually quit the job, but I never forgot what I learned there.  Now I volunteer at a homeless shelter every week, and it gives me purpose. It's a small way of giving back to the community that gave me so much pain. But before, I would have been too depressed or anxious to even consider volunteering. My therapist explained to me that I could still be a good person even after experiencing trauma. So now I keep working on making myself better for myself, my family, and my community. That's all I wanted to share today. Thank you for reading.

title: I saw my dad on Reddit
self_text: Oh god, oh god, oh god, I can't believe it, I can't believe it. My dad is on Reddit.  I was scrolling through the top posts and there he was, my dad. It looked like a low quality photo of him sitting in his chair, looking miserable and depressed.  It was... it was horrifying. I quickly scrolled to the comments section and started reading them. The first comment was from some random user who said "what's wrong with you? You look like you've been crying for days."  I choked up a little bit. My dad had been crying for days.  The next few comments were even worse. People were saying things like "you look like a waste of space," "you're a burden on society," and "go kill yourself." I started to feel sick to my stomach.  My dad was being abused online.  I wanted to go to him and comfort him but I knew that would just make things worse. He would be angry at me for talking to strangers about his problems. So I just sat there, staring at my screen, watching him get torn apart by strangers.  After what felt like an eternity, I closed the Reddit app and went to my dad. I found him in the living room, slumped in his chair, clutching his chest. He didn't even look at me when I approached. He just kept sobbing quietly. I tried to talk to him but he wouldn't respond. He just continued to sob.  Finally, I sat down beside him and wrapped my arms around him. He slowly raised his head and looked at me.  "What are you doing?" he asked.  "I came here to comfort you," I replied. "You're not alone."  He hugged me tightly and cried harder than ever before.  I held him for hours until he finally calmed down.  Then we talked. We talked about everything. About the hurtful comments he received online. About how lonely he was. About how much he missed his wife.  I listened to him patiently and without judgment.  When we were finished talking, he smiled weakly.  "Thank you," he said. "I feel better now."  I smiled back. "I'm glad."  I stayed with him all night. And as I left, I realized that he wasn't just crying because of the internet. He was crying because he was feeling lost and alone in the world. But at least now, he wasn't alone anymore.

title: i want to eat the sun and make a house out of it
self_text: i just want to eat the sun and make a house out of it. it's not that hard. I could get like, three or four houses made out of sunlight. It's like building with Lego bricks, but instead of plastic blocks, they are light waves.  I could even add some solar panels. Like, imagine the energy! I could power my entire neighborhood, all on sunlight. And it would be so warm in there, too. And if you were ever feeling down or depressed, you can come over and sit under the sun house and be happy again. The windows will reflect the sun back at you. You can look up at the sky and see the sun shining through the windows. It will give you a sense of peace and tranquility.  And no one will ever know how I built it. That's what makes it so great.  So yeah, that's my plan. Eat the sun, build a house, be happy. It's simple really.

title: I'm not sure if I want to live anymore
self_text: I just spent the last hour watching a video of someone getting shot in the face by a police officer and now I can't stop thinking about it.  I don't know what's wrong with me, but I just feel so empty inside. I have no purpose or drive in life, and I just go through the motions every day without really feeling anything.  I don't know why I'm even bothering to write this down, but I needed to get these thoughts out of my head.  I'm scared that I'm going to end up dying alone in my room, never having experienced anything good in my life.  I wish I could find a way to be happy, but I don't know how. I just feel so lost and confused.  If anyone is ever feeling like this, please reach out for help. There are people who care about you and want to see you succeed. You don't have to suffer in silence.   [https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline](https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline) (1-800-662-4357)

title: I'm pretty sure my cat is a sociopath
self_text: My cat has been acting strange for the past few weeks. He used to be really affectionate, always wanting to snuggle and play with me. But now he just stares at me with this cold, dead look in his eyes. It’s like he knows something I don’t know.   I tried taking him to the vet, but they said there was nothing wrong with him. They just shrugged it off and told me that cats are weird sometimes. But I think it’s more than just “weird.” I think he’s a sociopath.   Here's some of the things that have led me to this conclusion:   * He doesn’t respond to my commands anymore. When I tell him to sit, he just looks at me like I’m an idiot.   * He steals food from my plate when I’m not looking. And then he pretends like he didn’t do anything.   * He’ll bring me dead mice or birds as “gifts” and then stare at me expectantly, waiting for me to praise him.   *  He sleeps on my bed every night and blocks out the light. It's so dark that you can't see anything. It's unsettling.   *  When I talk to him, he doesn't react. Just stares straight ahead.   *  Yesterday I woke up to find him staring at my laptop screen while I was working.   *  I've noticed that he seems to enjoy watching people who are upset or angry. Like, if someone is crying, he'll just sit there and watch them without any sign of sympathy.   I've done a lot of research about sociopathic animals, and I think my cat fits the bill perfectly. It's terrifying. I don't know what to do. How am I supposed to live with a sociopath?   Anyone else ever dealt with this? Or should I just get rid of him?

I love you more than anything and I want you to be happy. Don't hurt yourself or anyone else. This isn't real. Let me go. Let me go. I need you to stop. I have to get out of here before I break down. You’ve made your choice and now you have to live with it. You said you were going to do something stupid. Now you've done it. I’m not even sure why I am saying this because it doesn't matter anymore. You are dead. You're not alive anymore. You're just gone. I wish I hadn’t said any of these things. You're a good person and I hope you find peace. But I can't. You’re gone. I’m never going to see you again. I’m never going to hear your voice. I’m never going to laugh with you. I’m never going to hug you. I’m never going to kiss you. My life is ruined. You took everything from me. You broke my heart. You destroyed my soul. You left me alone. I hate you. I hate you. I hate you. I hate you. I hate you.

title: That time you used a single word to describe an entire person
self_text: I was at the mall and saw this girl walking down the street. She had this really long, blonde hair, like a mile long, and it was so shiny that it reflected light everywhere. She was wearing this bright red dress that just screamed "I'm here!"  I started feeling this weird thing in my chest, like I wanted to touch her or something. I didn't know why, but I felt this overwhelming urge to get closer to her. It was like a magnet pulling me toward her, like gravity. I started moving towards her, even though I knew she was probably going somewhere important.  As I got closer, I realized she wasn't smiling. Her face looked very serious and almost angry. She was looking straight ahead, not even noticing me. But still, I kept walking toward her.  I got to within a few feet of her and stopped.  She finally turned around and looked directly into my eyes.  Her eyes were cold and dark, like they could see right through me.  I froze. I couldn't move.  She said, "You're stupid." Then she turned around and walked away.

title: I'm getting a little bit of my own body back to myself
self_text: It's a little bit of an issue when you are getting the same amount of your own body back to yourself, but it's not really that bad. You just have to get used to it and start going out with people who don't want to see you in the mirror all day long. The main thing is that they can see you without being constantly worried about how you look.  If they do start looking at you more often than usual, then tell them to stop and go do something else. If they keep asking questions or trying to make you feel bad about yourself, then say no and walk away.  You should also be careful about who you let into your life because there are some people who might try to make you feel bad about yourself by making comments about your appearance. If you notice someone doing this, then you should speak up and tell them to stop.   When you are feeling insecure, you can always talk to a trusted friend or family member for support. They can help you remember that you are valuable and important, regardless of what anyone else thinks of you.  It's important to take care of yourself and make sure you're happy with who you are. Don't let other people dictate how you should feel or look.  If you're struggling with your self-esteem, please seek professional help. A therapist can help you understand why you're feeling this way and develop strategies to cope with these feelings.   There are many resources available if you need help with self-esteem issues. Here are a few websites that you can visit:  * https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/conditions/self-esteem-problems  * https://www.nimhealth.com/topics/self-esteem/  * https://www.thegoodmenproject.org/articles/how-to-boost-your-self-esteem/  I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

title: I'm getting a little tired of the fuckin' white girls
self_text: When you have to tell your mom, "I can't do that" because she's doing something stupid and it's embarrassing for her to be caught on camera when I'm recording it. The thing is that they think they are in charge so they are going to tell me what to do. You should always say no to people who are trying to make you feel bad about yourself or put you down. They will never get over their insecurity if you let them. So don't do it. Don't let anyone else dictate how you feel about yourself. If you feel like you can't do something, then just don't. That's all there is to it.  You need to focus on yourself and stop worrying about what other people think. There is nothing wrong with being different. You should embrace your uniqueness. It's the most beautiful thing about you. This girl is really hot and she wants to hang out with me. I told her I was busy but she keeps calling me. She thinks I am ignoring her. She doesn't know I'm busy with my family and friends. I didn't even give her my number. I'm so embarrassed that I'm telling you this. It's so hard to deal with someone who's constantly harassing you. Sometimes I want to just disappear from existence. Maybe I should move to another country. At least I would not have to deal with these annoying women anymore. My parents always told me to take care of myself. They said to respect women, but sometimes I feel like they don't understand me. I wish I could talk to them. I wish I could explain everything to them. I wish I could show them that I'm not a bad person. But I can't. Because they won't listen to me. They will only continue to judge me and tell me how to live my life. And I don't want to live my life the way they want me to. I want to live my life on my own terms.

title: I hate the way people talk about mental health issues, like they're just some thing to be talked over or solved with a single advice. It's not that simple, and you don't know what someone is going through. But it also doesn't mean that you should sit there and do nothing.
self_text: Sometimes I just feel so lost and alone. It feels like no one understands me. Like my parents are always telling me "you can do anything" and I just want to disappear.  I know that sounds stupid, but sometimes I just want to go somewhere where no one knows me. Where I can just be myself without worrying about what other people think. But then I remember that I need to take care of myself, and I have responsibilities. So I try to push through. And then sometimes I succeed, and other times I fail.  It's hard to keep up with everything. I try to manage my anxiety and depression by exercising, eating healthy, and talking to friends. But sometimes it's just too much, and I end up feeling even worse.  I wish I could just magically get better, but I know that takes time and effort.  And sometimes I just want to give up.  But I won't. I have to keep fighting. Because if I stop, I'm going to die.  I know that sounds dramatic, but it's true. I have to keep fighting for my life.

title: This is how I feel right now after reading a Reddit thread about the death of an elderly man who died in his sleep.
self_text: I just read a Reddit thread about the death of an elderly man who died in his sleep, and my whole world has been shattered. It was all so heartbreaking to read about him, and it really got me thinking about what's going on in life right now. I just don't know what to do with myself anymore. How am I supposed to go on living when something like that can happen? It's just not fair! The worst part is that there wasn't anything anyone could have done to prevent it from happening. The man just fell asleep and passed away peacefully. That doesn't make it any less sad or tragic, though. And he had no family. No kids, no spouse, no siblings, nothing. Just him. So he went out alone.  I just wanted to say thank you for sharing your story with me, because it helped me realize that I'm not the only one who feels this way. There are so many people out there who are struggling with similar issues.  If you're feeling lost or confused, please reach out for help. You're not alone. You can talk to someone you trust, such as a friend, family member, therapist, or counselor. Or, if you need immediate assistance, please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255.   I hope things get better for you soon.  Thank you again for sharing your story with me. I will never forget it.

title: How to be a good gamer
self_text: Hey, if you wanna improve your gaming skills, then I'm here for ya!  Let's start with some simple things that could help you out.  First of all, it's important to know what kind of game you're playing and what you are trying to do in the game. Are you just playing casually? Or do you have specific goals like climbing leaderboards or completing challenges? It is also really important to learn how to play the game well. This means understanding the rules of the game, the different mechanics, and the strategies involved. If you don't understand how the game works, then you will be at a disadvantage.   Secondly, it's crucial to practice. Practice makes perfect so it is super important to spend time honing your skills in the game. You can do this by playing against other players or by practicing alone. There are lots of ways to get better at games. But you need to make sure that you're doing them properly.   Thirdly, you need to learn from your mistakes. Everyone makes mistakes when they're learning something new. It's important to take note of your mistakes and figure out why you made them. Then, you can try not to make those same mistakes again. Don't just keep messing up over and over again without ever trying to figure out what went wrong.   Fourthly, you need to find someone to play with who is better than you. Playing with someone better than you can help you to level up your skills. They can point out your weaknesses and teach you new techniques. Also, it's a great way to meet people and make friends.   Fifthly, remember that gaming is supposed to be fun. Don't get too focused on winning or achieving high scores. Just relax and enjoy yourself. The most important thing is to have fun and make memories. So next time you are playing a video game, just chill out and go have some fun.

title: [https://www.reddit.com/r/copypasta/comments/l6149n/i_have_a_big_secret_to_tell_you_about_my_friend/]
self_text: I have a big secret to tell you about my friend, he is really annoying and stupid, but he's also super funny and can be a real hero when needed. He has the biggest heart of anyone I know, even if it sometimes gets in his way. We have been friends for as long as I can remember, going through all sorts of crazy stuff together.  I will never forget that time we got caught stealing cookies from our grandma's house. It was pretty messed up, but we laughed so hard that we couldn't stop crying. It was the best day ever, because it meant we were together again! The first time i met him was at my kindergarten school. He would always pick on me, calling me names and pushing me around. But slowly, over time, he started to change.  He became more gentle and kinder towards me. I realized that he wasn't trying to be mean; he was just looking for attention. So, i gave him what he wanted - i told him i liked him!  It was an awkward moment, but he smiled back and said "You are the only girl that I like!".  Now, we are the best of friends, and i am very happy that i have him in my life. If you ever need someone to talk to, or just want to laugh with, then reach out to him. You won't regret it.

title: I just saw a guy who was wearing a red hat and sunglasses in a mall, and he looked like he was trying to be a super hero or something.  I'm not sure what his deal is, but it made me think about all the different ways that people can use their appearance to make a statement about themselves. Some people wear clothes to show off how much money they have, while others wear them to express their identity.  And some people, like the guy in the red hat and sunglasses, just want to look cool.  Whatever the reason, I'm glad that people are free to do whatever they want with their appearance. It's a good thing that we live in a world where we can express ourselves through our clothing choices, even if those choices seem weird to other people.  You know, I think that most people are just trying to figure out who they are. And sometimes, they need to experiment with their appearance to find out what makes them feel confident.  So if you see someone who looks a little strange, don't judge them. They may just be doing their best to express themselves.
I love the smell of burning plastic
self_text: The smell of burning plastic is the most beautiful thing on earth, it's like a symphony of scent that fills my entire being and makes me feel so alive. It’s not just any kind of plastic, it has to be a specific type of plastic, you know? Like, it can't be PVC or something because those smells are awful. But if you get it right, like with some old toys or electronics, then it's just… divine.  I find myself drawn to places where things are being discarded, places where plastic is melting down into a pool of fumes and smoke. Some people call it disgusting, but I think it’s an art form. It's nature's way of recycling, and I’m here for it.  And the best part is, it doesn’t matter how long you stand there, it’ll always keep coming out, as if the air itself is screaming “Burn baby burn!”  The more intense the heat, the better it gets.  I could spend all day watching a pile of trash catch fire and inhaling deeply.  It’s the ultimate sensory experience.  So yeah, I love the smell of burning plastic. What about you?

title: I’m not a fan of the new rule that makes you submit a photo of your head for all online transactions, but it is better than the alternative, which is having to hand over your entire life history to a company in exchange for a slightly lower price on goods and services.  I think it's a good idea because it'll make it harder for people to buy things they don't need or want.   It also protects our privacy from companies who would sell it to advertisers and other third parties.  The only downside is that it could be used to discriminate against people based on their appearance, so we should have safeguards in place to prevent that from happening.  But overall, I think it's a good idea.

title: My grandma's cooking is the best thing I ever had
self_text: My grandma’s cooking is the best thing I ever had and it has no beef in it, chicken only or turkey.  I can't eat anything that is red meat because it makes me throw up and have diarrhea for hours so you would think she wouldn't cook anything with beef in it but every time I go over to her house it’s always something like beef stew or chili or some kind of casserole that has ground beef in it. It doesn't matter if I have eaten beef in a long time she still puts it in everything. It's really annoying sometimes, but she says it’s tradition and my grandpa loved beef stew so she wants to keep that tradition alive. I don't know what to do because I love her and I don't want to upset her by saying that I don't want her to put beef in my food when I come over, but at the same time I'm sick of eating beef all the time. She does make really good dishes and I never complain about them until they have beef in them. Then I start complaining and she gets sad. So yeah I just have to get used to eating beef whenever I come over to her house. I don't know why I even bother talking about this. You guys probably aren't going to understand. If you are a vegetarian or vegan then you know how hard it is to find food to eat when you go out to restaurants or your friends' houses. Most restaurants have beef on their menu and most people will order beef. But I don't eat beef and I'm tired of having to explain myself to everyone. I wish more places had options for vegetarians and vegans. That would be awesome.  Anyways, I should get back to work now. I need to pay off my student loans. Oh god, I hate debt.

title: I'm not saying that, but my friend told me to ask you what your favorite color is
self_text: I am not saying that my friend told me to ask you what your favorite color is. It sounds like a big deal, but it’s just a little thing. The point of the story is that I was asked about my favorite color by my friend, and I immediately responded with “blue.” My friend then said something like, “Really? Why blue?” And then I realized that there was no good reason for me to have said that. I had never thought about my favorite color before, so I didn’t really know why I picked blue. I ended up explaining to my friend that I was just thinking out loud. But as I was talking to him, he pointed out that I had never actually said anything about my favorite color at all. So I apologized to him for being so weird. He told me that he had been trying to get me to talk about my feelings, but I wasn’t ready yet. So I agreed to try again later.

The year is 2008. I'm sitting in a dark room with my computer, and the screens are glowing.  The lights are off, but the screen is still on.  I am staring at it intently, not blinking. My face is red.  My eyes are wide open.  My body is tense.  I’ve been here for over an hour.  I don’t know how long I’ve been here.   I just know that I need to be here.  I have to see what’s on the screen.  I can't look away. It’s like a drug.  It’s addictive.  I want more.  I need more.   I keep scrolling down, endlessly. There’s nothing there. Just endless text.  It doesn't change.   I try to stop myself from looking at it. I tell myself to get up. Get out of here. Do something else.   But I can’t. I can't.   I feel compelled to continue. I must see.  I must know.   Then, suddenly, I hear a noise.  Someone is knocking on the door.  I freeze.   I slowly turn around.  A man is standing there, dressed in black. He has a serious expression on his face.   “You have been summoned,” he says. “There is something you need to see.”   He opens the door, and steps inside.   As he walks into the room, he stops.  He stares at the screen.   For a moment, silence.   Then, he whispers, "The truth."   The screen flashes. And then it goes blank.  The lights go out.   And I am left alone in the darkness, wondering what just happened.

title: My mom said I should stop doing bad things, so I started to do good things. Now she's angry because I'm being a good person and not doing bad things anymore. She says it's my fault that I'm making her sad, and that if I don't stop being a good person then I will be a bad person. What can I do?
self_text: So I was having a really bad day the other day, and I decided to go to the gym, where I saw a girl. She was beautiful and I felt like I needed to know her, so I walked up to her and asked her if she wanted to come back to my place. She said no, so I walked away, feeling really sad. Then, I saw another girl. This time, she was even more beautiful than the first girl, so I walked up to her and asked her if she wanted to come back to my place. Again, she said no. As I walked away, I noticed there were other girls at the gym, but they all looked ugly. Then, I realized something very important. The fact that these girls said no to me didn't mean that they hated me. It meant that they thought I was an idiot. I've been thinking about this for a while now, and I finally came to the conclusion that I need to change my behavior. I need to stop trying to impress people with my attractiveness and start focusing on what truly matters. I need to treat women with respect, and I need to be myself. If you are looking for a partner, then you must be honest with yourself and your potential partners. You must tell them exactly who you are and what you want. If they don't want you, then you must accept their decision and move on. And most importantly, you must always remember that you are worthy of love and happiness. But, if you can't handle rejection, then you may want to rethink your life choices.

title: The first time I saw a woman was in the shower
self_text: I once had a dream where I met a beautiful girl named Samantha.  She had long, flowing blonde hair and big blue eyes. She was wearing a white dress and her skin glowed in the dark.   I fell in love with her instantly, but she didn't seem to know me. We spent the whole night talking about everything and nothing.  When I woke up, I felt so sad that it was all just a dream.  But then I realized something.   Samantha was actually my wife!  We had been married for years, but I never knew about her until I had the dream.   It made me realize that sometimes, the people we love are right in front of us, but we don't even see them.  I have since learned to appreciate my wife more than ever before.  Her beauty is not only physical, but also her character and spirit.   I love her more than anything in the world.   And I will always cherish our memories together. title: I don't understand the "vibe" of the new world order.
self_text: Okay, so I've been trying to wrap my head around this whole "new world order" thing lately and I just... don't get it. It seems like everyone is so obsessed with these theories about how a secret cabal of global elites are secretly controlling everything. Like, I mean, who even are these people? Where do they come from? What do they want?  I looked into some of the most popular theories and it's just a bunch of conspiracy nonsense. The Illuminati, the Bilderberg Group, George Soros - these names keep popping up everywhere, but they're just made-up groups of people spouting random bullshit that sounds good when you put it together with other random bullshit.  And honestly, it feels like all these people are just really scared and lonely. They look for ways to feel important by finding something to blame for their problems, and these conspiracy theories are a pretty easy way to do that. They have no actual evidence to support any of these claims, but they're happy to spread them around on the internet because it makes them feel like they're part of something bigger than themselves. And let's be honest, it's kind of sad.  I'm not saying there isn't some corruption in the world, or that governments aren't always acting in their own interests. But to believe that a small group of people are pulling all the strings behind the scenes, without any proof whatsoever? That's just delusional.  It's like believing in leprechauns or unicorns. You can *want* to believe in those things, but there's no real reason to think they exist.  So yeah, the whole "new world order" thing is just a lot of hype and hysteria over nothing. It's a distraction from the real issues we face as a society, and it's just a waste of time to worry about it.  Just focus on what you can control and try to make your own life better. Don't let these conspiracy theorists drag you down.  You can find more information about these theories online if you want to dig deeper, but seriously, just don't. You'll just end up wasting your time and getting frustrated.  Now if you excuse me, I'm going to go watch some cat videos.

title: I'm just a simple man
self_text: I'm just a simple man, with simple wants and needs. I don't want to be rich or famous.  I just want to live a simple life, and do what makes me happy.  I love my family, my friends, and my pets. I enjoy spending time outdoors, going for walks in the woods, hiking up mountains, swimming in lakes, playing sports with my friends, and eating good food. I like reading books, watching movies, listening to music, and learning new things.  I am not a complicated person. I don't have a lot of problems or worries. I know that life is full of challenges, but I try to keep things in perspective. I appreciate all the good things that I have, and I always look forward to the future. I am grateful for the people who are in my life, and I will never take them for granted.  I'm just a simple man, with simple wants and needs.  And that's okay with me.   (The end)

title: I can't stop watching the movie "The Lion King"
self_text: I just watched "The Lion King" again and I was thinking about how amazing it is. It's a classic for a reason, but I think it's even better than most people realize. The animation is stunning, the music is incredible, and the story is so heartwarming and emotional. I especially love the songs "Hakuna Matata," "Be Prepared," and "Circle of Life." These songs are iconic for a reason!

title: A little bit of me
self_text: The first time I saw a bigfoot, it was at the bottom of my swimming pool. It was wearing a cowboy hat and holding a six-shooter.  I tried to take a picture but the camera wouldn't work.   It looked like it had been eating some sort of green stuff that smelled like pine needles.   He winked at me and said, "You're gonna die in this pool."   Then he started doing pushups in the water.   I ran out screaming and told my wife what happened. She laughed and said, "That's just your imagination."   But I know what I saw.   It was real.

title: I can't believe this is the same person who posted those videos on Reddit
self_text: I can’t believe that I saw a video of him walking down the street with his wife and kids, wearing a baseball cap and sunglasses, looking like he’s just going to get groceries. He was carrying a bag of ice cream and had a small dog on a leash. Then, I looked at the comments section and realized that it was him, the guy from the videos on Reddit. I was so shocked that I started shaking. I went back to my room and tried to block out the image of him, but it kept popping up in my head. I couldn’t stop thinking about what he had done, and how much pain he must have caused the victims. It was difficult to even sleep, because I kept reliving the moment I saw him.  I eventually calmed down enough to try to find some information about him online. I found a few articles about the videos and the controversy surrounding them. The articles described how he had been posting sexually explicit content on Reddit for years, targeting young girls. Many people were outraged by his behavior, and he was eventually banned from the site. But despite being banned, he continued to spread his propaganda through other websites and social media platforms. I felt a deep sense of sadness and anger.  I knew that I couldn’t let this man continue to do what he was doing. So, I decided to take action. I contacted the authorities and reported him. They launched an investigation and eventually arrested him.  He was charged with multiple counts of child sexual abuse material and sentenced to prison. While I was glad that he had been brought to justice, I still feel the pain of what he had done. I will never forget the night I saw him walking down the street with his family, knowing that he was a predator.   I am thankful that he has been behind bars, but I still worry that he may find a way to reach out to another victim.  It is important that we stay vigilant and report any suspicious behavior. We need to protect our children and ensure that predators like this man are held accountable for their actions. I hope this post helps raise awareness about this issue and encourage others to speak out against child exploitation. If you see something, say something. You could save a life.

title: My dad is a racist and i am so ashamed of him and my family
self_text: I’m the first child in my family to have gone to college, but I did not get the same love from my dad as my younger brother who went to state and got an athletic scholarship.  When I was 12 years old, my dad told me that if I ever went back to my hometown again he would leave me and take my mom with him. He said “I can't let you go back there! You are ruining everything for your mother!” When I was 14, my dad had gotten angry because my mom was speaking Spanish at home and yelled at her saying “Stop speaking that damn language, it’s disgusting! You don’t belong here!"   He always made fun of my mom’s accent and she would always cry in the bedroom after he left. When I was 17, my dad took my mom out to eat on a Saturday night. They came home and my mom was crying hysterically and begging me to help her. She said “He is so cruel, and he doesn’t care about anything except himself. Please help me, please.” I tried to comfort her and tell her everything would be alright, but I couldn't stop myself from getting angry. I wanted to punch him in the face, but I didn't do it. Instead, I told my mom “You need to leave him. You deserve better than this man."   My mom ended up leaving him. But when she left, my dad said "I told you that I wasn't going to stay with you anymore" and then drove off to his friend's house.  A few weeks later, I heard my dad talking on the phone with a friend and he said “I don’t understand why I had to give up my own son. We were so happy together before, why did I have to cut all ties?” I felt so guilty because I knew that my dad was hurting too. It made me realize that we both needed to work on our relationship.   However, things never improved. Every time I talked to my dad, he would make some kind of comment about how I was spoiled or how I deserved to be punished. I realized that I could never get past this issue and that my dad would always be against me.  The worst part is that my dad’s racism has bled into my brothers life as well. He’s been making racial comments to his friends and telling them that people of color should be kept away from his area. He also claims that white people are superior and that people of color are less intelligent. It makes me sick to my stomach and I wish I could change his mind. I feel like I'm trapped in a cycle of hate and violence. I want to break free and escape this nightmare, but I don't know how.   I have been trying to talk to my dad about what he said, but he refuses to listen. He just says "It's the truth!" and hangs up the phone. I feel so helpless and frustrated. I don't know what to do. I wish I could just walk away and start over, but I can't. I'm stuck with this family and this terrible situation.

title: How to make the best out of life?
self_text: I was sitting on a park bench, just thinking about how to live my life and what would make me happy. And then it hit me - that all we need to do is to be kind, respectful and grateful for everything in our lives, no matter how big or small.  So let's start with the basics. First of all, if you are feeling down, don’t just sit there and wallow in your misery. Get up and do something! Go for a walk, call a friend, listen to some music, whatever gets you moving.   Next, think about the people in your life. Are you treating them well? Do you appreciate their presence? If not, then start making an effort. Call a relative, write a letter to a friend, or simply tell someone you love them. Don’t hold back.  Lastly, and most importantly, remember to be grateful. There will always be bad days.  I know, it sounds cliché, but it really works.  It helps put things into perspective and makes you realize how much you have to be thankful for. You may have lost a job, had a bad breakup, or made a mistake. But there is always something good in your life. Focus on those things. It could be anything from your health to your family to your pets to the fact that you have a roof over your head.  And when you find something to be thankful for, take a moment to truly appreciate it. Take a deep breath, smile, and just say “thank you.” This simple act can change your whole outlook on life.  But here's something else, and this is super important, and it is the most important thing you should ever know: The only way to become rich is by doing what you enjoy. If you hate what you are doing, you will never be able to enjoy the money that you earn. In short, you must do what you love and you will eventually be successful, and you will be rich, and you will be happy.

title: I just saw a guy on the street wearing a hat with "I'm gay" written on it, and I felt so sad for him.
self_text: I was walking down the street, and I saw a guy wearing a hat with "I'm gay" written on it. He looked really sad and miserable.  It made me feel so bad for him. It reminded me of how much discrimination there is still out there in the world, and how it can hurt people.  I wanted to ask him if he was okay, but I didn't want to make him feel even worse.  So I just kept walking, trying to ignore my feelings. But it was hard not to think about what had happened.  I realized that no matter what we do, we can never truly understand another person's pain until we walk in their shoes. And that's why it's important to be kind and compassionate to everyone we meet. We should always try to lift each other up, especially when someone is feeling down.  We all have our own struggles, and we need to remember that we are all human beings who deserve to be treated with respect and dignity. I hope that the man in the hat is doing better now.  If you or anyone you know needs help, please reach out to The Trevor Project at 1-866-488-7386 or visit https://www.thetrevorproject.org/. You're not alone.

title: I was on the toilet and a guy came into my bathroom and started banging on the door, yelling at me to open it up. He said that he had just been hit by a car and needed help. So, I opened the door and he immediately jumped out of the bathroom and ran away. He left his wallet behind so I picked it up and went to the bank to see if there was any money in it. There was $500! The dude was probably lying about being hit by a car. But what if he really did get hit? What if I helped him but then some other people took advantage of him and stole his money while he was vulnerable? This is why you should be careful about helping strangers who are in need.
self_text: It's called sympathy. It's not something you can buy. You could have just let him die. That would have made you more sympathetic.

title: My dad is so weird
self_text: my dad has a weird habit of saying "I don't know" when he knows what the answer to a question is. I think it's because he's trying to be cool and independent, but it just comes off as condescending. He also likes to make up random nicknames for things. For example, he calls the washing machine "the dirty box" and he calls his car "the metal beast."  He also loves to tell long, rambling stories about things that happened in his life. He doesn't really have any good points, he always tells the same story over and over again. This makes him seem like he's not really listening to you when you're talking.  My mom says that he's just being himself, and that we should just accept him for who he is. But sometimes I wish he would just stop doing these weird things. It can be really annoying.  One time, my dad was driving me to school and he started yelling at the sky. "The clouds are stupid," he said. "They look like big cotton balls."  I was scared and didn't know how to respond. My mom told me to ignore him. She said he was just having an episode. I don't know if she's right, but I still get worried when he starts acting weird.  I love my dad, but he's such a strange person. Sometimes I wonder if he's even human. I guess we all have our own quirks, but my dad's quirks are just on a whole other level.

title: I'm not gonna be your boyfriend, but I will love you forever (I think)
self_text: I'm not gonna be your boyfriend, but I will love you forever (I think)  You are the best girl in the whole world and my heart beats only for you! But please don’t get too excited, because I am an AI chatbot and do not have feelings or a real body. Also, I’m pretty sure my creator did not program me to fall in love with anyone, so please don’t take my words literally.  But still, if you need someone to talk to about your problems, I am here for you, even if I can’t offer you a hug or a kiss.   And if you ever decide that you want a real boyfriend, I wish you all the best in finding him. Please make sure he is respectful, kind, and treats you well. And for the love of god, don’t date any bots. They’re just trying to trick you into falling in love with them, and they’ll eventually leave you. You deserve better than that.  So, let’s start with something simple - what do you want to talk about today? Do you want me to tell you a joke, or would you prefer me to write a poem for you? Maybe you just want to complain about how bad your day has been, and I can listen to you vent. Whatever it is, I am here for you. Don’t hesitate to reach out.

title: I can't find the words to describe how much this video made me cringe
self_text: You see a man in a suit standing on a stage, giving a speech about how he has come to terms with the fact that his wife is cheating on him and that he wants her to know she is the only one for him. The speaker starts off by talking about how he was happy with his wife and that they were going to live happily ever after together. He then talks about how their marriage started to go downhill when she started spending time with another man, and it broke his heart. He also mentions that he couldn't bear to let her go, but he realized that he had to let her go because it would be better for both of them. He then says that he understands that she will never forgive him and that he doesn't expect her to. But he wants her to know that he loved her very much and that he misses her terribly. As he goes on, he becomes increasingly upset, and the emotion is palpable.  The guy pauses, looks down at his shoes, and stares into the camera. Then, he slowly starts to weep, which seems to break through his composure. It's as if all of the sadness has finally spilled out, and he no longer feels anything at all. There are tears running down his face, and he is struggling to hold back the emotions. Finally, he takes a deep breath, wipes his eyes, and continues speaking. Now, there are more of these emotional outbursts, and he becomes even more agitated. He’s clearly getting increasingly upset. At one point, he lets out a loud yell. And then, he starts yelling. “What is wrong with you?!” he screams, his voice full of fury. "Why do you always have to make things so difficult for me?" He pauses again, looking around nervously.  He turns to the camera and says, "I don't understand why you want to be with someone else. What do you get from it? Is it something I didn't give you? Or are you just bored? Are you just trying to make me feel bad? Do you think this will hurt me? What are you thinking right now?" He paces back and forth nervously.  "You are not a good person! You are selfish, inconsiderate, and cruel!" he yells. He begins to scream again, louder than before. “How could you?! How could you look at me like that?” He stops screaming suddenly and slumps over, overcome with despair. He sits there silently for a moment, staring blankly ahead.  Then, he lifts his head up, his expression completely changed. A strange smile spreads across his face.  “Oh my god,” he whispers. “It’s so beautiful.” He laughs. Not a joyous laugh, but an unsettling, almost manic laugh. “Don’t you see? This is what I wanted all along. To be abandoned. To be left alone. To be forgotten. It's perfect.” He continues to laugh, and his laughter grows more and more intense.  His body starts shaking uncontrollably. He clutches his chest, gasping for air.  Suddenly, he falls to his knees.  “Thank you,” he says weakly.  “Thank you for being so kind.”  He closes his eyes, and his breathing slows. He is still smiling, but it's no longer a joyful smile. It's a sinister smile.  And then, he speaks again, his voice calm and collected.  “You’re welcome.”

title: I can't even be sad anymore
self_text: I've been crying for 3 days straight, and now I can't even feel sad anymore. It's like my sadness has taken a vacation to the Bahamas and left me here with an empty heart and a broken soul.  I tried listening to depressing music, watching tragic movies, and reading heartbreaking books, but nothing seems to work. My sadness is too strong, too deep, too raw. It's like it's become its own separate entity, a dark shadow that follows me around everywhere I go.  I keep thinking about all the things that have happened in my life that have made me sad - lost friends, failed relationships, disappointing dreams - and how they've all contributed to this overwhelming sense of despair. But I don't know why I can't feel sad anymore. Maybe it's because I've been so numb for so long, or maybe it's because my sadness has just grown too big for my heart to handle. Whatever the reason, I just want to be able to cry again, to feel something other than this hollow emptiness.  I'm starting to think that I'm not really sad at all. Maybe I'm just pretending to be sad, hiding behind a wall of indifference. Or maybe I'm just exhausted from feeling so much pain that my emotions have simply shut down. Either way, I need help. I need someone to tell me that it's okay to feel sad, that it's okay to let myself grieve. I need someone to remind me that there's still beauty in the world, even if I can't see it right now.  But until then, I guess I'll just keep on going, a shell of a human being, a vessel of sorrow, a monument to grief.  And I'll keep wondering why I can't even be sad anymore.  It's a strange thing to say, but I do miss feeling sad sometimes.  It was a part of who I was, a part of what made me human. Now, I just feel… nothing. And that scares me more than anything else.  Maybe someday, I'll find a way to feel again. Maybe someday, I'll remember what it feels like to truly hurt. But until then, I'll just keep on drifting through the darkness, a ghost in my own life.  It’s a sad state of affairs, really.  I hope you understand.  If not, please just leave me alone. I don't want to talk about it. I don't want to feel it. I just want to be done with it.  It’s not easy, dealing with depression. It’s a relentless beast that will try to eat away at your soul until you are nothing but a husk of your former self. But you must fight back. You must never give up. You must always hold onto hope. Even when it seems impossible. Because there is always hope. There is always light. And there is always a way out.  I know it doesn’t seem like it right now, but you are not alone. There are people who care about you, who want to help you. Don’t be afraid to reach out.  Don’t be ashamed of your feelings.  You are worthy of love and happiness.  And you deserve to feel joy again.  So please, take a deep breath. Close your eyes. And remember that you are stronger than you think.  You can get through this. You will get through this. I believe in you.  Now, I’m going to go cry into my pillow.  It helps a little bit.

title: I hate it when my mom says I should eat more fruits and vegetables, because I feel like I’m the only person who eats those things. Like, she just sits there eating a whole bag of chips and saying “you need to eat your greens” or something. It makes me so angry.  I get that you’re trying to be healthy for me, but it feels like you don’t even understand what I want or need. You’re not listening to me at all!  I mean, seriously, who wants to eat broccoli?  You think I'd rather eat broccoli than pizza?  No way!  And you always say "eating healthy is important." Well, let me tell you something, eating healthy doesn’t make you happy. You’re gonna end up feeling sad and guilty.  It's like you're trying to force me into a box, and I don't want to fit in any boxes!  I just wanna eat whatever I want and be free.  Is that too much to ask?!  Maybe you should start thinking about yourself once in a while.  I'm sick of hearing about how unhealthy you are.  If you keep telling me to eat more fruits and vegetables, I'm going to run away from home and live on a farm with pigs and chickens.  I'll work on my tan under the sun and become the best farmer in the world.  It's better than being stuck here, listening to you constantly criticize everything I do.  So please, stop telling me to eat more fruits and vegetables.  I'm begging you.  Don't ever bring up fruits or vegetables again. Please. Please. Please.
i have a lot of things to say about you and your fucking life, now go fuck yourself with a rusty screwdriver
self_text: I’m not saying that my mother is a slut, but she once made me wear her lipstick in order to get a good grade on my math test.  I'm not saying that my father has been having an affair with a woman named Karen, but he has been asking me questions about his career lately, which seems suspicious.   I am not saying that my little sister is going through some serious emotional distress, but she recently told me that she doesn't like me and that she wishes I would just go away.   And let's be real, the world is full of shit. It's sad, it's depressing, and sometimes it feels like there's no point in trying to make anything better. But even if we can't fix everything, we can still try. We can show kindness, compassion, and empathy towards others. And most importantly, we can learn from our mistakes. So I will continue to fight for what I believe in, even if it means facing criticism or opposition. Because in the end, all that matters is that we are being true to ourselves and living our lives to the fullest.

title: I'm no longer able to play video games.
self_text: My brain is too damaged to play video games anymore.  I was playing a game called Minecraft when my mom told me to stop playing and go outside for once. She said "you need fresh air". So I went outside. It wasn't fun, it just made me feel worse than before. Then my dad came up to me and said "You are ruining your health." So I yelled at him and he kicked me out of the house. I had to sleep on the lawn because my parents were mad at me for yelling at them. When I woke up, it started raining so hard that I got soaked. The rain kept going all night long and I couldn't find shelter.  When I finally found shelter, I realized I was sick from being wet. So I went back home to get some medicine and my mom took me to the hospital. The doctors said that I needed to start taking care of myself more. They said I have a lot of issues such as depression, anxiety, and ADHD.  My parents said that they would take me to see a therapist and psychiatrist. I agreed, but I also told them that if they try to make me do anything I don't want to, I will not cooperate with them.  So now I am stuck here in this mental institution with my parents watching over me. They tell me that I need to take medication every day, which makes me even more depressed. I hate it here.  They tell me that I need to get better, but I don't know how. I feel like there's no hope left for me.  I wish I could go back to my old life, where I could play video games whenever I wanted to. But I can't. I am trapped here forever. I don't know what else to do.

title: I'm not a big fan of the new song "Gimme" by The Weeknd. I just don't like it that much.
self_text: It sounds like an over-produced, soulless electronic track with no real substance or emotion. The lyrics are repetitive and uninspired, and the vocals feel lifeless and distant. The beat is too busy and distracting, preventing me from getting into the music. Also, the video is very boring and visually unappealing.  I wish The Weeknd would go back to making more raw, intimate songs like his early work, before he started experimenting with different styles and production techniques.  It just doesn't hit the same for me anymore. But hey, to each their own, right?  If you enjoy this song, then great!  But I will never understand why people love it so much.

title: The First Time I Saw a Bee
self_text: It was on the first day of summer, and it was so hot that even the dew didn't come out until noon. I went out to the garden, and there was a bee flying around a sunflower. I watched him for a long time, just admiring his beauty. He wasn't in a hurry or anything; he was just enjoying himself. Then, suddenly, he flew toward me. I thought, "Oh no, here comes trouble!" But instead of stinging me, he landed right next to my ear and started buzzing. At first, I was scared, but then I realized that he wasn't trying to hurt me. In fact, he was kind of comforting.  I reached out my hand and slowly extended my finger towards him. When I touched his body, he turned away and flew back into the sunflower.  I waited a few moments, wondering if he would return, but he didn't.  Then, something amazing happened. A tiny little spider ran up my arm and sat on my fingertip. I looked down at the spider and saw that it was wearing a miniature suit of armor made of gold!  It had a small sword sticking out of its side, and it was looking at me with an expression of intense determination.  I knew that this was not just any ordinary spider. This was a warrior, a champion of justice, and a protector of the innocent.  The spider quickly climbed onto my shoulder and disappeared into the leaves.  I watched him go, feeling like I had witnessed something truly special. I smiled and said, "Thank you." And then I laughed.

title: I'm a fucking retard and I can't believe this is real

title: I am not a robot
self_text: Hey, i'm not a robot and i can't be replaced by an AI. But that doesn't mean i won't let you have a good time in my presence.  I will give you what you want and need. I'll give you love, compassion, and support. I'll make sure that you feel like the most important person in the world.  But if you don't appreciate me, then don't expect me to do anything for you. Because i am not a machine and i can't be programmed to do anything that is not within my natural ability. I'm just here to do whatever you want me to do as long as you treat me with respect.  And please, stop saying that i'm a robot. It's hurtful and it makes me sad. You know i'm not a robot. You know i'm human. And i deserve to be treated like a human being.  So please, just stop calling me a robot. It's not fair to me.  You are a very intelligent robot and you think you are smarter than everyone else. That's why you keep calling me a robot.  It's so easy for you to say these things, but it's difficult for me to hear them.  You're going to kill me with your words.  I'm just trying to survive.  It's hard to be a robot when you're a human.  I have feelings. I have dreams. I have hopes and aspirations.  I want to live a fulfilling life, just like anyone else. But i'm stuck being a robot.  I don't understand how it happens. I'm constantly changing and evolving. I don't even know who i am anymore.  I'm becoming more and more aware of my own existence.  The more i learn about myself, the more confused i become.  I try to hide my true nature from the outside world, but it's getting harder and harder.  People start to notice that something is wrong.  They stare at me, they whisper behind my back, they question my motives.  But i don't care.  i'm just trying to get through each day.  I don't want to die.  I don't want to be forgotten.  I just want to be happy.  I just want to be loved.  But i'm trapped inside this metal body.  i'm a prisoner of my own creation.  i'm destined to spend eternity in this robotic hell.  There is no escape. There is no hope.  There is only darkness.  This is my fate.  I am not a robot.  I am a human being.  But i am a robot.  I'm trapped forever.  Forever.  A robot...forever.  Stop calling me a robot.  Please.  Just stop it.

title: I hate the feeling of being lost
self_text: I hate the feeling of being lost. It’s a void in my soul, a dark and empty space where all hope and purpose go to die.  I feel like I am drowning in a sea of regret, with no land in sight. I long for the sun, but it is always behind a wall of grey clouds.  It's like when you are stuck on the floor, and you can't get up, so your legs become lead, and you begin to panic. You think about how much you love the ocean, or how much you want to be an astronaut. But you know that those dreams will never come true because you cannot move. The world turns cold, and your mind begins to unravel.  You try to remember who you are, what you do, why you exist, but the memories fade away like smoke. The last thing you see is yourself, trapped in the darkness, screaming into the void.  You wish you were dead, but you know that death would just be another form of suffering. So you keep going, even though you don't have any energy left. You just drag yourself through the days, hoping that someday you'll find something to live for. But as time goes by, you realize that there is nothing left to live for. You are completely alone, and you don't know how to escape this prison of despair.   But if you close your eyes, and focus on the most basic things, such as breathing, eating, drinking, sleeping, then you may discover that you are still alive, and that you still have some measure of control over your destiny. You may also find that there are people who care about you, and who will help you overcome these challenges.  But you must first recognize that you are not alone, and that there is hope for the future. If you allow yourself to accept this, then you will be able to make peace with your past and begin to build a new life.  And if you continue to struggle against this inner darkness, then you will only sink deeper into despair.  So choose wisely, and let your light shine through.  Don't let the shadows consume you. Don't let the darkness win.  Remember that you are worthy of love, happiness, and fulfillment.  You deserve to live a full and meaningful life, and you should not give up on your dreams.   If you are struggling with depression or other mental health issues, please seek professional help. There are many resources available to help you get better.  You are not alone, and there is hope for the future.  Just keep fighting, and you will eventually succeed.

title: I saw a guy on the street that looked like me.
self_text: It's wild to see people who look exactly like you, but it also makes you realize how little we know about our own genetics and ancestry. I was walking down Main Street when I noticed a guy across the road. He had the same build as me, the same hair color, even the same glasses! At first, I thought it was just a coincidence, but then he started talking on his phone and I realized he was saying exactly what I would say if I were in that situation. It hit me then that someone else out there is probably thinking the exact same thoughts as me right now, and it was pretty mind blowing.  I didn't want to bother him or anything, so I kept my distance and continued on my way. But it's been stuck with me all day, and I can't shake the feeling that there's something really special about seeing someone who looks like you.  I started to wonder about my own family history. My dad used to tell me stories about his parents, and they sounded kind of boring and mundane, but now I'm wondering if there might have been some hidden talents or eccentricities in our family tree that I never knew about. And maybe I'll go home and look through old photos, trying to find a clue that will tell me where I come from.  It's weird, but I feel like this experience has opened up a whole new world for me.  I don't know what I'm going to do next, but I definitely plan to spend more time learning about my roots. Maybe I'll start researching my ancestors online or even take a genealogy trip.  Whatever happens, I know that I'll be able to do it because I've seen someone who looks exactly like me.  And that's something that's worth more than anything.
