It is important that we maintain a strong military presence around the world so that other countries know that we are willing to use force if necessary.   I hope that everyone understands that we must stand together as a nation to protect our interests.  Let us all work towards peace and prosperity for the future generations. Let's stay vigilant and ready to face any challenges. It's time for us to show the world that we are not afraid to stand up for what is right.  I am proud to be an American citizen, and I believe that we can overcome any obstacle if we remain united and focused on our goals.   We should never forget that freedom comes with responsibility. We must always be prepared to defend our values and beliefs. The future depends on our courage, strength, and determination.  Thank you for your support, and may God bless America!

title: My sister is my best friend and I don't think she likes me anymore.
self_text: My sister is my best friend and I don't think she likes me anymore. She keeps telling me to leave her alone, but she doesn't stop being around me. I don't know what to do because I want to be friends with her, but she seems annoyed when I'm around her. It feels like I'm ruining her life or something. When she does talk to me, it's usually just short, simple sentences, almost like she's speaking to a child. She used to tell me all about her day and how she was feeling, but now she just says "I'm fine" without making eye contact. If I try to initiate conversations, she'll quickly change the subject or walk away. I tried asking her why she was acting this way, but she just said, "Just leave me alone." She said that once before, and I don't understand why she's so angry at me. I don't feel like I've done anything wrong. It's been going on for months, and I'm starting to wonder if she even wants to be friends with me anymore. I feel lost and confused, and I don't know who to turn to.  My mom told me that she might be getting bullied at school, but I didn't want to believe her. She said that she had been having trouble sleeping lately too, and she seemed really sad. I asked her if she wanted to talk about it, but she just shook her head and mumbled, "Leave me alone." I'm starting to think she's dealing with something serious, and I feel helpless because I can't do anything to help her. She's my only family member, and I don't want to lose her. But I also can't stand being treated this way.  I've tried everything I could think of to fix things, but nothing has worked. I've apologized for everything I could have possibly done wrong, but she still won't forgive me. She just tells me to go away and not bother her. It's like she's trying to push me out of her life completely. I miss her very much, and I don't know what to do. I just want to be a good brother again, but I can't seem to do anything right.  I wish she would just explain to me what's going on, but she refuses to speak to me. It's like I've become invisible to her. I feel like I'm trapped in a prison of silence and resentment. I don't know how much longer I can take it.  I guess I'll just keep hoping that she'll come around eventually. But honestly, I'm afraid that she's already given up on us.

title: i can’t believe that my mom just told me to stop eating
self_text: I can't believe that my mom just told me to stop eating. I was eating a sandwich, and she said "Stop eating!" I didn't know what to do.  I started crying, because I didn't want to stop eating. It was the best sandwich ever!  Then she said, "I don't mean you should stop eating, I just meant that you shouldn't be eating so much."  I still didn't understand what she meant, but it made me feel better.  I took another bite of my sandwich, and then I went to bed.  My mom came in later, and she said, "You are going to make me sick!"  I thought she was angry with me, but I wasn't.  I just wanted to eat more sandwiches.  So I asked her, "Why are you mad at me?"  She said, "Because you keep telling me that you can't stop eating!"  I said, "But I really want to stop eating!"  She replied, "That's what you say every time!"  I got up, and I walked out of the room.  When I left, she called after me, "I love you, but please stop eating!".  I didn't know how to respond.  I just kept walking away, and eventually I ended up at the park.  There, I saw a little boy playing with a dog.  The boy threw the ball for the dog, and the dog ran after it.  I watched them play for a while, and I started to forget about my problem.  After a few minutes, I realized that I needed to go home.  I turned around, and I saw my mom standing there.  She said, "Are you okay?"  I said, "Yes, I am fine."  She smiled, and she said, "Good. Now come on, let's go eat something."  I looked at her, and I thought to myself, "What is wrong with my mom?".  But then, I remembered what she had said earlier.  "I love you, but please stop eating!"  I realized that she wasn't being mean to me.  She was actually trying to help me.  I smiled back at her, and I said, "I will try to stop eating."  She hugged me tightly, and she said, "I knew you could do it!".  We went inside, and we ate some ice cream together.  It tasted really good.  I realized that even though I have a problem with eating too much, my mom loves me anyway.  And that's all that matters.

title: I just found out that the word “pussy” is actually a synonym for “bad” in spanish!
self_text: That’s so weird, it’s like the Spanish language has been trying to trick me all my life! It was hard to believe at first but then I realized it makes sense since many other words have similar meanings in both languages! For example, “muro” which means wall can also mean “to be bad”.  It’s funny and interesting to see how different cultures use words differently!
